name: RevLifter
author: RevLifter

sections.description:
RevLifter for WordPress Plugin allows seamless onboarding and tracking for RevLifter’s intelligent offer platform, empowering retailers to optimize their eCommerce businesses for profitable growth. With this plugin, you can drive conversions, reduce cart abandonment, identify growth opportunities, and solve inventory and merchandising challenges to reduce costs.

Usage

  1. After activating the plugin and configuring the settings, you can access the RevLifter dashboard by visiting the designated URL provided by RevLifter’s team.
  2. Utilize the self-service platform to gain insights, control, and guidance for optimizing your eCommerce retail business.
  3. Leverage the expertise of RevLifter’s team of experts for additional support and assistance.
  4. Explore the experimentation hub to learn what works best for your business and leverage automation for quicker results.

Features

  • Seamless integration of RevLifter’s intelligent offer platform with your WordPress website.
  • Drive conversions and reduce cart abandonment through targeted offers and incentives.
  • Identify profitable growth opportunities for your eCommerce retail business.
  • Solve inventory and merchandising challenges to reduce costs.
  • Access RevLifter’s self-service platform for control and insights to optimize growth.
  • Receive guidance and support from RevLifter’s team of experts.
  • Utilize the experimentation hub for learning and automation.

Event Tracking

The RevLifter plugin tracks the following events:

  1. Page View:

    • Information tracked: browser, device, and screen dimensions.

  2. Basket/Cart:

    • This event is fired every time a change is made to the basket, including:
      • Adding to cart from the category/search page.
      • Adding to cart from the product detail page.
      • Any modifications to the cart on the cart page.
    • Information tracked: each item in the cart, currency, taxes, total price, and shipping. Cart item information includes SKU, Name, Categories, Brand, Price, Quantity, On Promotion, and Image.

  3. Product Page View (PDP):

    • This event is fired when a user lands on any product page.
    • Information tracked: product details such as SKU, Name, Categories, Brand, Price, Quantity, On Promotion, and Image.

  4. Sale:

    • This event is fired when a user completes a sale.
    • Information tracked: same data as the basket event, along with the order ID.

For more detailed information about each event and their payload, please visit the Event Tracking – Standard – RevLifter Help Center.

Support

For any queries or assistance, please contact our support team at support@revlifter.com.
sections.installation:
1. Download the RevLifter plugin from the official WordPress plugin repository or obtain it from the RevLifter website.
  2. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/revlifter directory, or install the plugin directly through the WordPress plugins screen by searching for “RevLifter.”
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress.
  4. Go to the “RevLifter” settings page, located under the “Settings” menu in your WordPress admin dashboard.
  5. Enter your RevLifter API credentials provided by RevLifter’s team.
  6. Save the settings.
sections.faq:
Is there a cost associated with using RevLifter’s intelligent offer platform?

No, RevLifter’s intelligent offer platform is available free of cost for users. You can leverage its features and capabilities to optimize your eCommerce retail business without any additional charges.

If you have further questions about pricing or plans, please visit RevLifter’s website or contact their team for more information.= Is there a cost associated with using RevLifter’s intelligent offer platform? =

Please visit RevLifter’s website or contact their team for information on pricing and plans.
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Initial release of the RevLifter for WordPress Plugin.
